text: The Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 (CDPA; c. 48) is an Act of the Parliament of the United Kingdom. It makes copyright law in the United Kingdom, which used to be taken from the Copyright Act 1956. It says that copyright for creative works lasts for 70 years after the author dies (50 years for works made on a computer). A work can only be protected by copyright if it is one of: literary work, dramatic work, musical work, artistic work, movies, sound recordings, broadcasts, and text of published editions.CDPA 1988, ยง 1(1) ==References== Category:1980s Acts of the Parliament of the United Kingdom Category:Copyright Category:1988 in the United Kingdom
title: Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988
